page.title: 03 St.Peters Church
page.content: As a church St.Peters dates back to 1064. Its outside has typical flint walls with stonework around the windows and doors. Inside the Victorianrenovation still dominates with a beautiful brass eagle lecton. More recent is a mosaic behind the alter. During the Nepolionic Wars the tower wasone of a signal chain for the navy, so the white ensign is flown from the tower on festive occasions. the chuch hall was opened by Edward Heath the then Prime Minister who had attended the local school. With the Partland Cottage it is the centre for many village groups-see Scouts and Brownies-disco and old time dancers-play school and disabled group. Other groups meet at the Memorial Hall which was originally a wooden hut in the First World War.
